question: Based on the provided evidence, answer the following question: Who was Pascal Sirand-Pugnet's employer as of 2046?. If the evidence is insufficient to answer the question, return 'INSUFFICIENT_INFORMATION'.

content.source_1:
**Breaking News: Renowned Researcher Pascal Sirand-Pugnet's Ties to University of Bordeaux Confirmed**

A thorough investigation has revealed that esteemed researcher Pascal Sirand-Pugnet has indeed worked for the prestigious University of Bordeaux in France. This finding sheds light on the academic background and professional affiliations of Sirand-Pugnet, a prominent figure in the scientific community. According to credible sources, Sirand-Pugnet held a research position at the University of Bordeaux, where he contributed to various projects and collaborated with esteemed colleagues. This affiliation is substantiated by multiple sources, including academic publications and institutional records. Dr. Marie-Hélène Mucchielli, Dean of the Faculty of Science at the University of Bordeaux, confirmed Sirand-Pugnet's association with the university. "We are proud to have had Pascal Sirand-Pugnet as a member of our research team. His expertise and dedication to his work have been invaluable to our institution," Dr. Mucchielli stated in an exclusive interview. A review of Sirand-Pugnet's publication record reveals a significant number of papers co-authored with University of Bordeaux researchers, further solidifying his connection to the institution. One such paper, published in the esteemed journal _Nature Communications_, lists Sirand-Pugnet as a co-author alongside several University of Bordeaux researchers. Data from the university's annual reports and research funding records also support Sirand-Pugnet's affiliation. According to these documents, he received funding for his research projects from the university's research grants program. When asked about his experience at the University of Bordeaux, Sirand-Pugnet himself commented, "My time at the University of Bordeaux was instrumental in shaping my research focus and methodology. The institution's rich academic environment and collaborative spirit enabled me to make significant contributions to my field." This confirmation of Sirand-Pugnet's affiliation with the University of Bordeaux provides valuable insight into his professional background and reinforces his reputation as a respected researcher in his field.
content.source_2: December 2044 was a chilly winter month in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. The snowflakes gently fell onto the grand staircase of the Philadelphia Museum of Art, casting a serene silence over the bustling city. Amidst the festive atmosphere, Pascal Sirand-Pugnet, a renowned researcher, walked through the museum's halls, his footsteps echoing off the marble floors. As he made his way to his office, Pascal couldn't help but feel a sense of pride and accomplishment. It had been a remarkable year, filled with groundbreaking discoveries and innovative projects. His work at the Philadelphia Museum of Art had been instrumental in pushing the boundaries of art conservation and restoration. Pascal's day began like any other. He sipped on a steaming cup of coffee as he reviewed the latest reports from his team. The museum was abuzz with activity, preparing for the upcoming holiday season. The sound of laughter and chatter from the staff and volunteers filled the air as they worked tirelessly to transform the museum into a winter wonderland. As the morning wore on, Pascal received an unexpected visit from the museum's director, Dr. Rachel Kim. She arrived at his office, a look of excitement on her face, and announced that the museum had been selected to host a prestigious international art exhibition in the spring of 2045. The exhibition, titled "Masterpieces of the 21st Century," would feature some of the most iconic works of art from around the world. Pascal's expertise in art conservation and restoration made him the perfect candidate to lead the project. Dr. Kim tasked him with assembling a team of experts to work on the exhibition, ensuring that each piece was meticulously preserved and presented to the public. The news sent a thrill through Pascal's veins. He spent the rest of the day pouring over the exhibition's details, envisioning the layout, and brainstorming with his team. As the sun set over the Philadelphia skyline, Pascal felt grateful to be a part of this esteemed institution, working alongside talented individuals who shared his passion for art and preservation. As December 2044 drew to a close, Pascal reflected on the incredible journey that had brought him to this moment. From his early days as a young researcher to his current position at the Philadelphia Museum of Art, he had been driven by an insatiable curiosity and a desire to make a lasting impact on the world of art. As he packed up his belongings and headed home, Pascal couldn't help but wonder what the future held.
